reviews.review_msg: I don't understand the hate against him. He is kind, fair, and if you study and follow his instructions you will pass. He explains everything clearly and wants students to succeed. Attend his class regularly and you'll do great for sure. Workload is a lot but  reasonable only if you keep up. Highly underrated and overhated prof!

You put in the effort, show up, participate, take note when he says what is a good example of exam question (if he says that, it's on the exam, and he says that a lot!) you'll pass tests. Participate! Get help from him at learning center(gives extra credit for coming). He wants you to pass, just ask for help. Marking is clear. Read the readings.

I took Chris in his first semester of KPU which was 2016. He was new to teaching at a college setting (coming from SFU) but transitioned smoothly. I see everyone crying about how hard he is and stuff but probably did not come to his office hours when you needed him. Honestly thats your fault if you're struggling, the onus is on you. Great prof...

I have never failed a class.... i get good grades, 3.0 GPA. This class was the hardest thing i have ever done, i tried so hard and yet i failed. Chris expects you to know everything and know how to write a 10 page research proposal paper... when this is a intro class and no one knows anything about it. Lectures the full 3 hrs... AVOID!!!!!!

One of many horrible profs at KPU. Doesn't respond to emails on time, doesn't clarify assignment criteria, expects students to know everything even though it's an intro course. Did a research proposal (9 pages), handed it in three weeks ago, and still haven't received my mark for it... the final is tomorrow. Avoid at all costs.
Tough marker and is harsh on his comments on the paper . Participation matters it is 15% . One midterm and final. Would not take him again.
Worst prof I have ever had. It is tough to listen to him as he is a terrible speaker, seems to be very awkward and goes off topic constantly. He expects too much for an intro class.
